title: â€˜Percy Jackson and the Olympiansâ€™: Hereâ€™s How to Stream Season Two onÂ Disney+
summary: Season two premieres on Disney+ and Hulu on Dec. 10 with two new episodes.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Everyone’s favorite demigod is back. Season two of Percy Jackson and the Olympians , the highly anticipated series adaptation of the popular fantasy novels , arrives on Disney+ on Wednesday (Dec. 10). In its first season, the series closely resembled the plot of the first book, “The Lightning Thief.” After watching the trailer for the second season, it’s expected that the new episodes will focus on the events of the second book, “The Sea of Monsters.” According to the Disney+ description, Percy will sets “sails to the Sea of Monsters to rescue his friend Grover and save Camp Half-Blood.” Walker Scobell will reprise his role as Percy, Leah Sava Jeffries as Annabeth and Aryan Simhadri will return as Grover. Percy Jackson & The Olympians season two premiers on Dec. 10 with the first two episodes available to stream now. With lat’s season premiere garnering 26.2 million views across Hulu and Disnâ€¦

title: 'You have to stand up and be counted' - history repeats itself for Newcastle
summary: Newcastle United show immense spirit to come from behind against Bayer Leverkusen only to concede another late goal.

title: 'No-one downing tools' - Alonso's stay of execution despite loss to Man City
summary: The deafening jeers that greeted former Barcelona boss Pep Guardiola before kick-off turned into away-fan cheers thanks to Manchester City's fine victory.

title: Can 'magic moment' Madueke find consistency for Arsenal?
summary: Noni Madueke might reflect on the Champions League win at Club Brugge as a landmark night in his Arsenal career - but can he find consistency?

title: Alonso's Real Madrid future uncertain after Man City defeat - analysis
summary: Champions League pundit Rory Smith looks at the future of Real Madrid's Xabi Alonso following their 2-1 defeat to Manchester City in the Champions League, which leaves the Spanish club on a run of two wins from their last eight games.

title: Madueke first goal was a magic moment - Arteta
summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says that Noni Madueke's first goal was "unbelievable" in their 3-0 defeat against Club Brugge.

title: West Ham watch in-form Clayton - Thursday's gossip
summary: West Ham are watching Clayton, Roma open negotiations over Joshua Zirkzee, Sunderland bid for Matteo Guendouzi, plus more.

title: Benfica boost knockout play-off chances with win over Napoli
summary: Jose Mourinho's Benfica pick up their second victory in the league phase of the Champions League with a 2-0 win over Antonio Conte's Napoli.

title: Kounde scores twice as Barcelona fight back to beat Frankfurt
summary: Defender Jules Kounde scores twice in three minutes to help Barcelona come from a goal down to beat Eintracht Frankfurt 2-1.

title: Leverkusen score late equaliser to deny Newcastle win
summary: Newcastle United concede another painful late goal as Alex Grimaldo rescues a dramatic Champions League point for Bayer Leverkusen.

title: Madueke scores twice in Arsenal victory over Club Brugge
summary: Noni Madueke scores twice and Gabriel Martinelli scores a third for Arsenal to beat Club Brugge 3-0 and maintain their Champions League winning streak.

title: Man City beat Real Madrid to pile pressure on Alonso
summary: Goals from Nico O'Reilly and Erling Haaland give Manchester City a 2-1 victory over Real Madrid at the Bernabeu, to pile pressure on Madrid manager Xabi Alonso.

title: Cornelius scores late winner as Copenhagen win at Villarreal
summary: Andreas Cornelius scores a stoppage-time winner as Copenhagen beat Villarreal 3-2 in the Champions League.

title: Atalanta fight back to dent Chelsea Champions League hopes
summary: Chelsea's hopes of qualifying automatically for the Champions League knockouts were dealt a blow as Atalanta come from 1-0 down to win in Bergamo.

title: Kudus and Simons score as Tottenham beat Slavia Prague
summary: Mohammed Kudus and Xavi Simons both score from the penalty spot for Tottenham Hotspur in a 3-0 win against Slavia Prague.

title: 'Magic' Martinelli scores stunning third for Arsenal
summary: Gabriel Martinelli becomes the first Arsenal player to score in five Champions League games in a row after netting a stunning third goal for the Gunners against Club Brugge.

title: Szoboszlai scores late penalty as Liverpool beat Inter
summary: Dominik Szoboszlai scores a late penalty as Liverpool claim a 1-0 away win over Inter Milan 1-0 in the Champions League.

title: O'Reilly equalises for Man City against Real Madrid
summary: Manchester City's Nico O'Reilly fires home from close range against Real Madrid to make it 1-1 in their Champions League match at the Bernabeu.

title: 'Remarkable' Madueke goal puts Arsenal ahead against Club Brugge
summary: Noni Madueke scores a "remarkable" goal to give Arsenal the lead against Club Brugge in the Champions League.

title: Emery wants to find 'solution' for loanee Elliott
summary: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery says he wants to "get a solution" for on-loan Harvey Elliott, who will "not definitely" be joining the club on a permanent basis.

title: YouTube TVâ€™s new plans are the Ã  la carte fix we needed
summary: YouTube TV will finally let you pay for just sports or news in a major bundle breakup.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR YouTube TV is launching over 10 new genre-specific plans in early 2026. The sports plan delivers major networks, FS1, NBC Sports, all of ESPN, plus access to ESPN Unlimited. Other options include news, family, and entertainment packages tailored to specific interests. Streaming was supposed to help people cut the cord and save. But as live TV bundles got more expensive, that promise faded. Now, YouTube TV is trying something new. Starting in early 2026, the service will move away from its one-size-fits-everything model and roll out a lineup of Ã -la-carte plans built around what people actually watch . So, instead of forcing everyone into a single, pricey base plan â€” currently $82.99 per month â€” YouTube TV is launching over 10 genre-specific packages.
